rules.evidence: Section 1(6) defines terms such as "consumer prices index" and "relevant power". Schedule 1, paragraph 2 and 4 introduce and define "pre-2026 claimant" and "severe conditions criteria claimant".
Schedule 1, paragraphs 4 and 6 define the criteria for a claimant to be considered a "pre-2026 claimant" or a "severe conditions criteria claimant", which affects their entitlement.

rules.rule: Act must specify responsibilities of the administering authority
rules.evidence: Section 1(1) states that "The Secretary of State must exercise a relevant power in order to secure that the amounts of the standard allowance...are at least the amounts calculated...". Similar responsibilities are mentioned in Section 4(1) and 5(3).

rules.rule: Act must include enforcement or penalties
rules.evidence: The provided text focuses on calculating benefit amounts and does not contain sections on enforcement or penalties for non-compliance or fraud.

rules.rule: Act must include payment calculation or entitlement structure
rules.evidence: Section 1(2) provides a clear 3-step process for calculating the minimum amounts of the standard allowance, including the use of CPI and relevant uplift percentages.

rules.rule: Act must include record-keeping or reporting requirements
rules.evidence: The text does not contain any clauses related to the keeping of records or reporting requirements for either the claimant or the administering authority.
